title: Deadliest Catch star ‘arrested on suspicion of heroin possession’
text:
Deadliest Catch star Jerod Sechrist has been arrested, according to reports

Jerod Sechrist, who appeared on Discovery Channel show Deadliest Catch, has been ‘arrested on suspicion of heroin possession’.

The 33-year-old was allegedly busted for drugs last week, according to reports.

In the police report, obtained by TMZ, the sometimes-reality star was arrested on an open warrant last week for a previous reckless driving case.

It was reported when police took him to the station around 3AM, they found a clear bag in his pocket which contained a white powder substance.

After an on-the-spot test, it was alleged the substance tested positive as heroin.

Jerod appeared on the 2016 season (Picture: Discovery Channel)

He was latest taken in on drug charges, reportedly felony possession of heroin and misdemeanour possession of drug paraphernalia.

Sechrist appeared in three episodes of the show back in 2016 as one of Captain Wild Bill’s deckhands on Cape Caution (which ran from seasons nine-12 of the show), most memorable for not being able to differentiate between male and female king crabs.

He caused the ire of his fellow crewmates seeing as it’s illegal to catch female king crabs.

Jerod’s arrest comes after, in August, fellow Deadliest Catch star Jake Harris was sentenced to 18 months in prison after being arrested on two felony charges of driving under the influence and possession with intent to manufacture or deliver a controlled substance, which was alleged to be heroin.

Having shown its 15th season earlier this year, Deadliest Catch is produced for the Discovery Channel and focuses on real life events onboard fishing vessels in the Bering Sea, during the Alaskan king crab, queen crab and snow crab fishing seasons.

Metro.co.uk contacted Tampa Police Department for comment.
